intro: Borreria brownii, commonly known as the Mexican borage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence. Borreria brownii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
